sentence.Network_en: Alex jumped up so violently that he overturned his glass of sherry.

sentence.Network_en: Sherry is half as strong again as table wine.
sentence.Network_cn: 雪利酒比佐餐酒酒劲强一半。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: alteration of archaic sherris, interpreted as plural, from Spanish (vino de) Xeres 'Xeres (wine') (Xeres being the former name of Jerez)

entry.tran: 雪利酒(原产自西班牙西南部的烈性葡萄酒，通常于餐前饮用)
entry.def: Sherry is a type of strong wine that is made in south-western Spain. It is usually drunk before a meal.

example.ex: I poured us a glass of sherry.
example.tran: 我给大家倒了杯雪利酒。

means.word_mean: 1. dry to sweet amber wine from the Jerez region of southern Spain or similar wines produced elsewhere; usually drunk as an aperitif
